name: Argentinosaurus
behaviors: Extremely large and slow, Argentinosaurus do not tend to travel long distances until they exhaust food resources in the area they currently inhabit.
Docile, passive, and happy to just enjoy eating, though they will defend themselves against any threat that feels brave enough to attack them.
Argentinosaurus are not comfortable with anything underneath them, and will stomp in alarm.

subItems.content: They are passive in water and CANNOT become aggressive if something is in their personal space, unless they are directly attacked.

rules.content: In water, their tails and necks can be ignored, though for the body, personal space rules still apply for non-Argents/non-Tier 0, who can choose to defend their space, or move.

subItems.content: They are semi-passive on land and can protect their personal space which is directly under their belly/feet and flying above them, only chasing down something that has directly attacked them or their hatchling/juvenile/adolescent.

rules.content: Since they are meant to be passive, spam calling is considered a passive-aggressive action. This behavior forces others to threaten and/or fight you and will be marked as a rule break.
Sub-Adults and Adults cannot defend or meat shield each other.
